utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I so I have COPD and it's usually like pretty manageable with my puffers and that. But just in the last like 3 days I feel like it's gotten a lot worse. You know, I, I feel like I'm coughing more often and I'm now, uh, kind of producing more sputum. Kind of like a green yellowy sputum uhm. I even notice that there is like a little bit of blood a couple times when I was like, really coughing hard. I’ve been finding it like harder to breathe than usual. I don’t have home oxygen or anything, and I'm not. I didn't think I was quite there yet, but this these last few days it's been. It's been really hard to breathe.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK, so this is happened in the past three days. Have your symptoms gotten better or worse over this time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I feel like they've been get maybe maybe getting a little worse. They definitely haven't gotten better,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and has this ever happened to you before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I’ve had I had some troubles like when I've been sick before where the cough is gotten pretty bad. This is probably this is probably the worst that I've had, but I have like I have had in my COPD been made worse by being sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK. Well, I guess the first thing we're going. So how's tbad, how bad is your shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like I I walked here fine, but I normally like can walk around the block and I go for a walk, usually a couple times a day to walk my dog and it's been just it's been a little bit trickier to do that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK. And uh have you ever had any hospitalizations in the past specifically for COPD exacerbations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I haven't. Uhm, like stayed over in the hospital. I like come to emerge a couple times.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright um. How many times?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think twice maybe over the last like three years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm when were you diagnosed with COPD?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm 4, 5 years ago?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Was it formally diagnosed using the proper testing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, they referred me to a lung, a lung doctor.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK. And have you had any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I feel like I may have had a fever last night. I felt really hot.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Did you check your temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I don't have a thermometer at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No problem. We can now check your temperature.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Here by the bed. I would say had a fever.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sure. And. Have you had any other symptoms? So have you had like a runny nose or stuffy nose? Any pain in your sinus?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think I think I have a I've had a bit of a like this pressure in the sinus area, but it's been the cough has been the thing that's been the most bothersome.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see and have you had a sore throat at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. A headache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? Maybe a little bit, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Diarrhea or Constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Abdominal pain.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. In have you recently lost weight unintentionally?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no, I wish but no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you had any night sweats where you feel like you're drenched in sweat at night?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And have you had any exposures to anyone who could potentially be sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um. Let me think I I meet my I meet a couple of friends to walk our dogs together outside and one of them was a bit sick for a bit. We try not to get too close, but maybe I don't know. Maybe sometimes we walk a little too close. We feel too safe 'cause we're like outside.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK um. And did your friend get a covid test done?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? I don’t know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: That's OK. OK, and you mentioned that you had COPD that was diagnosed four or five years ago. Any other medical conditions that you've been diagnosed with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um. Yeah I have a high blood pressure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you taking any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I’m not, I'm not I we talked about it, but I decided to try to change my lifestyle as much as I could 1st and I've also done that for the COPD. It's generally pretty like I've been really trying to take care of it, but um I feel like I maybe got sick or something this time, yeah, so my blood pressure is like OK right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My pressure and then I lost weight and started this walking more.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: That's great. That's really, really good that you're taking better care of yourself. Should definitely continue doing that.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Right?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And you've mentioned that you have some puffers. How often do you use those?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh like I have the one that I use every day. That I'm supposed to just use no matter what, and then the one that I use when kind of just when I need it. I probably use it like once every two weeks.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. Uhm? And you mentioned that your COPD’s are getting better. Do you find that it's affecting your life in any way affecting the way that you're doing your daily activities at at home or at work, if you are working?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I like pretty OK except for like if I get sick I so yeah, it's been.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I think it's like pretty well managed like I stay on top of my lifestyle now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Thats good, thats good. Do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, no allergies to medications ?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, good and. Do you, just a couple more to general questions. Have you traveled anywhere outside the province recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You, I guess I should have asked you earlier, but have you noticed any change in your sense of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any change in your sense of taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any confusion or fuzzy feeling?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK, any muscle aches in your body?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, and just kind of some questions about your living situation. Do you currently live alone? And I you mentioned that you have a dog? Are there any is there anybody, anyone else in the house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh my husband.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and. Do you currently work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I uh, like I've been working from home. I worked for the municipality.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see. Do you think you might have had any exposures to say dust or smoke or anything like that that could have worsened your symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, very rarely .

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I used to. I quit once they said I have COPD. I smoked 1/2 pack a day for probably 20 years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, and do you consume marijuana or any recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, alright, well I guess one more question, are there any lung diseases or heart conditions or cancers that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing that I can think of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, well that's those are all the questions I had for you. I will now do it physical exam and look at your vitals and listen to your chest. It's likely that what you have right now is COPD exacerbation, maybe just a like an infection that you got, which worsened some of your COPD symptoms. We would also have to rule out covid, so we'll be doing a covid swab and will decide based on the on your labs in your vital signs. It's instead of other things whether you need to stay in the ER and be admitted, or if you are good to go home, I will also talk to my attending and will make those decisions together and come back and talk to you. Does that sound good to you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds great. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
